settings.title: What are statistics in sports?
settings.bold_text: To understand the importance of statistics in sports, it's vital to know what they really are.
settings.text:
Statistics are numerical data that represent a larger sample of the population. In other words, they are used to measure and monitor different aspects of a specific population. It might sound Greek to you, but statistics are absolutely essential when it comes to sports.

Every sport collects the performance statistics of a specific athlete or the entire team. Statistics from races won, hitting percentage or lap times etc. Sports statistics are so diverse that machines calculate 90% of statistics. A good example is the boxing category, where blocks and punches count as points. These statistics motivate athletes and teams to raise their game.

One way to improve is to understand which skills need the most development. If this is done, players and athletes can develop and enhance their sports performance. Players can gain skills to improve future performance by identifying poor stats in certain areas.

settings.title: Uses of Statistics in Sports
settings.bold_text: Statistics have many uses in sports. The entire industry would be pointless without it. Almost every action that happens in sports depends on statistics. All virtual or real games are entirely based on this scientific discipline. Some of the crucial uses of Statistics in sports include:

settings.title: Decision Making
settings.text: In senior management, statistics are used to help make decisions. Analyse information from previous experiences and make the right decisions to prevent mistakes from happening. Managers and coaches make sports strategies with the help of statistics.

settings.title: Highlight areas for training/improvement
settings.text: Coaches review data from previously played games to highlight areas for improvement. A correct understanding of statistics can determine the success of a team or an individual athlete.

settings.title: VAR (virtual assistant referee)
settings.text: It is entirely based on statistics. Here, unique software that records and analyses data in real-time supports the referees' decisions. Judges consider every activity that takes place before making a decision. VAR provides accurate results through statistics.

settings.title: Sports Rankings
settings.text: These are based on the total points collected. Collecting data and sorting it from smallest to largest is part of statistics. In addition, if two teams are tied on points, the deciding factors are other factors, such as goals conceded and scored.

settings.title: Match Prediction
settings.text: Sports commentators and analysts utilise statistics to predict the aftermath of a game. For example, if a team has won its last five head-to-head meetings with the other team, there is a good chance it will stay that way.

settings.title: Sports Betting
settings.text: Betters in sports rely only on statistics. Online gambling uses special software for real-time data analysis and presentation to help potential clients. Gamblers use these statistics to predict the outcome of games before placing bets.

settings.title: Ticketing
settings.text: Online ticketing systems collect information about available seats and prices and then display that information on the Internet. It automatically calculates the position using a statistical support algorithm. When the space is full, the system automatically stops issuing tickets.

settings.title: Player Payments
settings.text: Most player payments are based on player performance. Statistics largely determine a player's performance. For example, a soccer player wins based on the number of goals he scores, the number of games he plays and the number of passes he makes. It is among the most important uses of sports statistics.

settings.title: Importance of Stats in Sports
settings.bold_text: Many people think that sport is all about thrill and excitement, so the question arises, "what makes statistics so important in sports?".
settings.text:
Statistics can help you understand why teams win and lose and how players and teams perform during the season. Statistics can tell a lot about a player, his strengths, weaknesses and how he behaves in different situations. It helps us understand the complexities of sports and gives us a unique perspective.

While statistics can be used to track individual performance, they can be used similarly to help teams improve their game and know how to prepare for future opponent teams. Team records and statistics, such as possession and goal percentage, can give them an idea of ​​what to do next. Looking at an opponent player/team's stats can help narrow down their strengths and weaknesses and show teams what they need to focus on and prepare for. They allow us to measure and track player and team performance, evaluate the success or failure of strategies and tactics, and more. It helps. Without statistics, our analysis of sports is blind. So, whenever you watch a game the next time, make sure you appreciate the power of statistics!

settings.title: Final Thoughts
settings.bold_text: Sports stats define a large part of an individual player or team.
settings.text: Learning how to use statistics as a development tool for improvement is very important, but it must be done correctly so that the focus is on more than just the numbers.
